result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles T Furlow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(4).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia, alcohol and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TH or CM. Do not live anywhere there is alcohol. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol.
Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

for Treatment (Incompetency); The Court Orders: These proceedings are suspended. The defendant is committed on 11/12/15 to DHS for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.

SIGNATURE BOND - RE-REFERRAL TO BMP
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $5,000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
